vulnerability_information:
> NOTE! Thanks for submitting a report! Please replace *all* the [square] sections below with the pertinent details. Remember, the more detail you provide, the easier it is for us to triage and respond quickly, so be sure to take your time filling out the report!

**Summary:**  Sessions are not properly logged out/ Information Leak

**Description:** I have two accounts that I control from my mobile Browser , As a concept of Session handling by browsers at a time one can only use one account with proper mapping of session and generated cookies . But when someone send DM or other data for my logged out account i still get  web Notifications , where i can read the DM of that logged out account .
All the Testing is done on Chrome Browser of my phone , I have video for the same

## Steps To Reproduce:

(Add details for how we can reproduce the issue)

  1. login with multiple accounts in Twitter one by one , saving your credentials for future
  2. Enable web push notifications for twitter
  3  now as a normal scenario login to one account and ask your friend to send you DM on 
      account other account which is not logged in
  4 . you can see the DM in the android notifications for websites that saying notification for mobile.twitter.com and DM displayed 

## Impact : session mishandling leading to my private data leak  , on clicking the notification my cookies of one account is being taken with the request for other account 

Moreover i am working on it , hope will help you to get your service better . please revert 



## Supporting Material/References:

  * List any additional material (e.g. screenshots, logs, etc.)

## Impact

1 .Session mishandling leading to my private data leak  , 
 2. on clicking the notification my cookies of one account is being taken with the request for other account 
3 . information getting delivered even after the session isnt their can lead to privacy breach
title: Improper session handling on web browsers

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

Please keep in mind that per our [program rules](https://hackerone.com/twitter), "attacks requiring physical access to a user's device" are not in scope for this program. Can you describe an attack scenario relying on this behavior which does not require the attacker to have access to the victim's device?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

hi.
Its not about physical access based attack . I know the severity of providing physical access 

how can i describe you the thing :

1 . Do you think that if i logout from a twiiter acccont from my mobile ( one plus 3T ) chrome brower , and still  i am getting nitifications ( web push ) ? Are you saying Its fine ? 
  Notifications about the private  DM destined to the logged out account ? i dont think it should be 

plz check you js library using to  push notifications

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Hi ,
As suggested by support mail from your side , I am explaining my concern and reason behind my disagreement with your bug categorization effecting the Bug payout

Issue Reported :-
                        As on opting for logout from  a web service . It literally means that my action of clicking the logout button will distroy my session at the server end and the cookies that was mapped to my session should be unusable after that . This as per my knowledge makes my browser session unauthenticated with server  .

Issue comes into picture as howcome twitter servers are unware of this session unauthentication stage , This is indicated my getting the webpush notifications ( showing all data that must only be notified to user after authentication  ( most importantly my DM )  even after user is unauthenticated 

So to summarize from my understanding twitter webserver responsible for pushing notification to only authenticated user is leaking the users private information  to unauthenticated user ( logged off)

Bug Category :-  The category is per the report should be 

1 . Unrestricted access to data (filesystem, database, etc.) :-
     user data is pused by the servers without any authentication restriction 

2  Flaws leaking PII or bypassing significant control :-
      Personal Information ( DM as in my video example) is leaked and  significant controll of user authentication  
       is bypassed 

Impact of this Vulnerablity:-

    Its very critical issue to provide acess to a protected data of an unauthenticated user ,  The main private information the authecticated user have is cookie and tokens pointing  to a valid session at server server .
User after loggout consider himself safe as he trust at the security implemented by twitter at server end 
which is so easily by passed here

Request:-
 i hereby request you in a very humble maner that please show me the way you categories my report and show transparency in your work .

Regards
Arjun Sharma

activities.message:
Thanks for following up, @arjuniet.
Could you provide some more information on the issue you are now seeing?

For now, I will reopen the HackerOne report until we have full understanding and are able to ensure that the issue is resolved. The public disclosure process will need to be put on hold during this process, and will not be resumed until the fix is validated.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Hello @arjuniet, thank you for following up! 
Please submit your new bug report. I will close this issue for now. 

We will have to hold off on public disclosure of this issue until the new report has been submitted. We would like to avoid the detail disclosure from this report leading others to discovering the new issue you have found.

Once that is all done, we can revisit the public disclosure process.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!
